intro: Pariana violascens, commonly known as the violet-flowered pariana, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a velvety texture, while its stems are often hairy. The flowers bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
